entry.title: Dual Gravitation
entry.summary: We propose a canonical relation between gravity and space-time noncommutativity.

entry.title: From factorizable S-matrices to conformal invariance
entry.summary: Lecture notes on factorizable S-matrices, thermodynamic Bethe Ansatz and integrable perturbations of conformally invariant models; J.A.Swieca Summer School 1991

entry.title: Homological (ghost) approach to constrained Hamiltonian systems
entry.summary: A survey of ghost techniques in mathematical physics, which can be grouped under the rubric of `cohomological physics', particularly BRST cohomology.

entry.title: An Introduction to 2d Gravity and Solvable String Models
entry.summary: Continuum and discrete approaches to 2d gravity coupled to $c<1$ matter are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 29pp. Lectures at the 1991 Trieste Spring School

entry.title: On a New Class of Integrable Models
entry.summary: We define a new class of integrable vertex models associated to quantum groups at roots of unit

entry.title: Discrete States in Two-Dimensional Quantum Gravity
entry.summary: Minor misprints corrected.

entry.title: W algebra, twistor, and nonlinear integrable systems
entry.summary: Small errors are corrected

entry.title: Operator content and modular property of Chern-Simons coupled to a massless scalar
entry.summary: Corrected with some rewording

entry.title: Horizons Inside Classical Lumps
entry.summary: Hopefully tex-able version.

entry.title: Conformal Turbulence
entry.summary: We describe conformal field theories, correlation functions of which satisfy equations of the two-dimensional fluid mechanics. Prediction for the energy spectrum is given, $E(k) \sim k^{-25/7}$.

entry.title: Comment on Disassembling Anyons
entry.summary: It is pointed out that Chern-Simons theories do not allow an anyon interpretation when spin is included.

entry.title: Gauge Theories on a Cylinder
entry.summary: (a few typos and an error corrected)

entry.title: On the quantisation of SU(2) magnetic monopole dynamics
entry.summary: We argue that there is no consistent quantisation of the two BPS SU(2) magnetic monopole dynamical system compatible with the correspondence principle.

entry.title: Target Space Description of W-Infinity Symmetry in Coset Models
entry.summary: Various typos corrected

entry.title: The generalized KP hierarchy
entry.summary: We propose one possible generalization of the KP hierarchy, which possesses multi bi--hamiltonian structures, and can be viewed as several KP hierarchies coupled together.

entry.title: A View From the Island
entry.summary: This is a brief and subjective description of ideas which formed our present field-theoretic understanding of fundamental physics.

entry.title: Complete Solution of SU(2) Chern-Simons Theory
entry.summary: Explicit and complete topological solution of SU(2) Chern-Simons theory on S^3 is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plain TeX, 11 pages, (4 Figures not included) Preprint IMSc--92/56

entry.title: Unimodality of generalized Gaussian coefficients
entry.summary: A combinatorial proof of the unimodality of the generalized q-Gaussian coefficients based on the explicit formula for Kostka-Foulkes polynomials is given.

entry.title: On Exact Evaluation of Path Integrals
entry.summary: Some mistakes have been corrected

entry.title: Quantum Black Holes
entry.summary: Clarified certain points and related it to other work.

entry.title: A Covariant Canonical Description of Liouville Field Theory
entry.summary: Original Version Corrupted by Mailer

entry.title: QED(1+1) by Dirac Quantization
entry.summary: (some errors corrected, slightly extended)

entry.title: Combinatorial Invariants from Four Dimensional Lattice Models: II
entry.summary: Revision contains rewording of selected text

entry.title: The role of mathematics in contemporary theoretical physics
entry.summary: Talk given at the 6th Philosophy-and-Physics-Workshop ``Epistemological Aspects of the Role of Mathematics in Physical Science'', FEST, Heidelberg, Feb. 1993

entry.title: Quantum Clifford Algebras
entry.summary: Quantum multiparameter deformation of real Clifford algebras is proposed. The corresponding irreducible representations are found.

entry.title: (Constrained) Quantization Without Tears
entry.summary: An alternative to Dirac's constrained quantization procedure is explained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages in Plain TeX, MIT CTP #2215

entry.title: A New Symmetry for QED
entry.summary: We demonstrate that QED exhibits a previously unobserved symmetry. Some consequences are discussed.

entry.title: BRST model applied to symplectic geometry
entry.summary: Two local macros are included (gothic.sty and fleqn.sty)

entry.title: Gauge Theories for Lineal Gravities
entry.summary: Here is summarized the gauge theoretical formulation and quantization of two popular gravity theories in (1+1)-dimensional time.

entry.title: Classical and Quantum Intertwine
entry.summary: Model interactions between classical and quantum systems are briefly discussed. These include: general measurement-like couplings, Stern-Gerlach experiment, model of a counter, quantum Zeno effect, SQUID-tank model.

entry.title: Developments in 2D String Theory
entry.summary: Lectures presented at the Spring School, Trieste, Italy 1993.

entry.title: Equations with infinitely many Lagrangians
entry.summary: Necessary conditions for a field theoretic equation of motion to be the consequence of variation of an infinite number of inequivalent Lagrangians are examined.

entry.title: Status of Fractional Superstrings
entry.summary: A brief review of the motivation and the present status of Fractional Superstring is presented. Talk at ``Strings 93'', Berkeley, May 1993.

entry.title: Supermembranes in 4 Dimensions
entry.summary: A non-parametric gauge for supermembranes is introduced which substantially simplifies previous treatments and directly leads to the supersymmetric extension of a Karman-Tsien gas.

entry.title: Strings and Causality
entry.summary: Notes of the author's talk at Cargese, May 19,1993. The calculation of the string field commutator is simplified by relating it to the short proper time, semiclassical string path integral.

entry.title: A new set of exact form factors
entry.summary: Some mistaken reasonings at the end of the paper omitted.

entry.title: The Projection Postulate of Quantum Mechanics on the Lightcone
entry.summary: We discuss an interpretation of the projection postulate that implies collapse of the wavefunction along the lightcone.

entry.title: Aspects of $σ$ Models
entry.summary: Some aspects and applications of $ \sigma$-models in particle and condensed matter physics are briefly reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, Latex, IC/93/399 Contribution to the Salamfest, Trieste 8-12 March 1993

entry.title: Hamiltonian Mechanics in 1+2 Dimensions
entry.summary: A complete list of all transitive symplectic manifolds of the Poincar\'e and Galilei group in 1+2 dimensions is given.

entry.title: Comment on ``Anyon in an External Eletromagnetic Field: Hamiltonian and Lagrangian Formulations''
entry.summary: We comment on a recent paper by Chaichian et al. (Phys.Rev.Lett. 71(1993)3405).

entry.title: Some Classical Solutions of Relativistic Membrane Equations in 4 Space-Time Dimensions
entry.summary: Various reductions, and soime solutions of the classical equations of motion of a relativistic membrane are given

entry.title: Topological Structures in the Standard Model at High $T$
entry.summary: Topological Structures in the Standard Model at high $T$ are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages in plain TeX, with PostScript figures (inside the TeX code!), MIT-CTP-2285

entry.title: Bäcklund transformation for integrable systems
entry.summary: We establish an explicit form of the Backlund transformation for the most known integrable systems.

entry.title: On Super-Liouville Operator Constructions
entry.summary: We review the construction of field operators of the N=1 supersymmetric Liouville theory in terms of the components of a quantized free superfield.

entry.title: Comment on "Equivalence of Several Chern-Simons Matter Models
entry.summary: It is shown that a recent claim of equivalence between three Chern-Simons theories is not tenable.

entry.title: Classical r-matrices and construction of quantum groups
entry.summary: A problem of constructing quantum groups from classical r-matrices is discussed.

entry.title: Black Holes and Open Strings
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn pending revision.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, 2 uuencoded figures, WITHDRAWN PENDING REVISION

entry.title: Special functions as structure constants for new infinite-dimensional algebras
entry.summary: Novel infinite-dimensional algebras of the Virasoro/Kac-Moody/ Floratos-Iliopoulos type are introduced, which involve special functions in their structure constants

entry.title: Some Aspects of $q$-Boson Calculus
entry.summary: The content of this work is concerned with Jordan-Schwinger calculus using $q$-deformed bosons.

entry.title: On the composite fermion approach in the FQHE
entry.summary: FQHE is presented in the form of non-unitary singular similarity transformation, which relates the Laughlin wave function (and its particle-hole conjugate) to the composite quasi- particle incompressible ground state. (ENSLAPP-A-478/94)

entry.title: Generalized QCD$_2$ via the Bilocal Method
entry.summary: We use the bilocal method to derive the large $N$ solution of the most general $QCD_2$.

entry.title: Current-Like Variables in Massive and Massless Integrable Models
entry.summary: Lectures delivered at the International School of Physics "Enrico Fermi", held in Villa Monastero, Varenna, Italy, 94.

entry.title: The $η$-Invariant as a Lagrangian of a Topological Quantum Field Theory
entry.summary: We dicuss functorial consequences of way the eta invariant of Dirac operators behaves under gluing and change of boundary conditions.

entry.title: Differential calculus on quantum groups: Constructive procedure
entry.summary: A brief review of the construction and classifiaction of the bicovariant differential calculi on quantum groups is given.

entry.title: Quantum Invariants of Knots and 3-Manifolds
entry.summary: Removed because of inappropriateness for e-print archives.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages (Removed because of inappropriateness for e-print archives.)

entry.title: Contravariant symbol quantization on $S^2$
entry.summary: We define an algebra of contravariant symbols on $S^2$ and give an algebraic proof of the Correspondence Principle for that algebra.

entry.title: My Encounters --- as a Physicist --- with Mathematics
entry.summary: 25th anniversary and new building dedication Centre de Recherches Math\'{e}matiques Montr\'{e}al, Canada, October 1994
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, LaTeX with 2 figures (available from author), MIT-CTP #2371

entry.title: Black Holes and Sphalerons in Low Energy Effective String Theory
entry.summary: Talk given at the 7th Marcel Grossmann Meeting on General Relativity, Stanford University, July 24-30, 1994.

entry.title: The Vacuum in the Light-Cone Representation
entry.summary: The mechanism by which the physical vacuum can be different from the perturbative vacuum in the light-cone representation is described and illustrated.

entry.title: Octonion X-product orbits
entry.summary: The octonionic X-product gives the octonions a flexibility not found in the other real division algebras. The pattern of that flexibility is investigated here.

entry.title: A Note on Color Confinement
entry.summary: An argument is given which exhibits color confinement in nonabelian gauge theory.

entry.title: Octonion X-Product and E8 Lattices
entry.summary: In this episode, it is shown how the octonion X-product is related to E8 lattices, integral domains, sphere fibrations, and other neat stuff.

entry.title: Minimal Affinizations of Representations of quantum groups: the U_q(g)--module structure
entry.summary: We describe the underlying U_q(g)--module structure of representations of quantum affine algebras.

entry.title: Fixed points, saddle points and universality
entry.summary: It is pointed out that the universality might seriously be violated by models with several fixed points.
entry.arxiv:comment: presented at "Infrared Quantum Physics", Paris, June, 1994, 5 pg

entry.title: Representations of Super Yangian
entry.summary: We present in detail the classification of the finite dimensional irreducible representations of the super Yangian associated with the Lie superalgebra $gl(1|1)$.

entry.title: Poisson Poincare groups
entry.summary: We present almost complete list of normal forms of classical $r$-matrices on the Poincar\'{e} group.

entry.title: Poisson homogeneous spaces
entry.summary: General framework for Poisson homogeneous spaces of Poisson groups is introduced. Poisson Minkowski spaces are discussed as a particular example.

entry.title: Dirac Monopoles and Witten's Monopole Equations
entry.summary: A simple solution of Witten's monopole equations is given.

entry.title: Recent developments in affine Toda field theory
entry.summary: Lectures at the CRM-CAP Summer School 'Particles and Fields 94' August 16-24 1994, Banff, Alberta, Canada.

entry.title: Introductory Lectures on Low Energy Supersymmetry
entry.summary: As the title indicates

entry.title: Generalising The Concept Of Maximal Symmetry Of Spacetimes In The Presence Of Torsion
entry.summary: A possible generalisation is given to the meaning of maximal symmetry in the presence of torsion

entry.title: OCTONIONS: E_{8} LATTICE TO Λ_{16}
Semihard Hadron Processes and Quark-gluon String Model
entry.summary: Resubmitted as hep-ph/9502316. Removed from hep-th. Incorrigibly inept submitter publicly excoriated.
entry.arxiv:comment: resubmitted as hep-ph/9502316. Removed from hep-th.

entry.title: Event-Symmetric Physics
entry.summary: I examine various aspects of event-symmetric physics such as phase changes, symmetry breaking and duality by studying a number of simple toy-models.

entry.title: OCTONIONS: INVARIANT LEECH LATTICE EXPOSED
entry.summary: The structure of a previously developed representation of the Leech lattice, $\Lambda_{24}$, is exposed to further light with this unified and very simple construction.

entry.title: Spin Connections and Classification of Inequivalent Quantizations
entry.summary: We discuss an extension of the quantization method based on the induced representation of the canonical group.

entry.title: Oddball determinants
entry.summary: A simplified direct method is described for obtaining massless scalar functional determinants on the Euclidean ball. The case of odd dimensions is explicitly discussed.

entry.title: Batalin--Vilkovisky Formalism and Odd Symplectic Geometry
entry.summary: It is a review of some results in Odd symplectic geometry related to the Batalin-Vilkovisky Formalism

entry.title: Comment on "Dynamics of Weak First Order Phase Transitions"
entry.summary: We comment on an earlier paper of M. Gleiser, regarding mechanisms of first-order phase transitions.

entry.title: On Soldering Chiralities
entry.summary: We study the soldering of two Siegel chiral bosons into one scalar field in a gravitational background.

entry.title: On Statistical Mechanics of Non-Abelian Chern-Simons Particles
entry.summary: Lee replies to the comment on "Statistical Mechanics of Non-Abelian Chern-Simons Particles" by C. R. Hagen

entry.title: Black Hole Entropy
entry.summary: Major developments in the history of the subject are critically reviewed in this talk.

entry.title: Bounded Bose fields
entry.summary: Examples for bounded Bose fields in two dimensions are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, plain TeX, submitted to LMP

entry.title: Gauge Independent Lagrangian Reduction of Constrained Systems
entry.summary: A gauge independent method of obtaining the reduced space of constrained dynamical systems is discussed in a purely lagrangian formalism. Implications of gauge fixing are also considered.

entry.title: Lorentz gauge and Green's formula in classical electrodynamics
entry.summary: We dicuss the resolution of initial value problems of electrodynamics in the Lorentz gauge.

entry.title: Some remarks on quantum theory and integrable systems
entry.summary: Some formulas and speculations are presented relative to integrable systems and quantum mechanics.

author.name: Robert Carroll
author.arxiv:affiliation: Mathematics Dept., University of Illinois, Urbana

entry.title: On Quantum Cohomology
entry.summary: We discuss a general quantum theoretical example of quantum cohomology and show that various mathematical aspects of quantum cohomology have quantum mechanical and also observable significance.

entry.title: Calabi--Yau Phases of the Superstring Vacuum
entry.summary: It is shown that the model X_{14}(7,3,2,1,1) has two Calabi--Yau phases.

entry.title: From Conformal Haag-Kastler Nets to Wightman Functions
entry.summary: Starting from a conformal Haag-Kastler net in 1+1 dimensions, Wightman functions are constructed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, latex, to appear as a DESY-preprint and in Lett. Math. Phys

entry.title: Sphaleron on $S^{3}$
entry.summary: An exactly solvable sphaleron model in $3+1$ spacetime dimensions is described
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 p, LaTeX, contribution to the proceedings of Journees Relativistes 96

entry.title: HBT Interference, Wigner functions and MC Simulations
entry.summary: A method of MC simulations including quantum interference, proposed recently by A.Krzywicki and the present author, is explained.

entry.title: Aspects of Dualities
entry.summary: In this talk, some aspects of duality symmetries are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to the proceedings of ICHEP '96, Warsaw, July 25-31, 1996; presented by A. Giveon

entry.title: Further remarks on quantum mechanics and integrable systems
entry.summary: Further formulas are presented involving quantum mechanics, thermodynamics, and integrable systems. Modifications of dispersionless theory are developed.

author.name: Robert Carroll
author.arxiv:affiliation: Mathematics Dept., University of Illinois, Urbana, IL

entry.title: Supersymmetry, Supercurrent and Scale Invariance
entry.summary: Contents: Generalities, Chiral supermultiplets, Super Yang-Mills theory, Superspace Feynman graphs, Renormalization, Supercurrent, Finite theories.

entry.title: Non-abelian Flux Algebras in Yang-Mills Theories
entry.summary: Contour gauges are discussed in the framework of canonical formalism. We find flux operator algebras with the structure constants of underlying Yang-Mills theory.

entry.title: Maximal subalgebras of matrix Lie superalgebras
entry.summary: Dynkin's classification of maximal subalgebras of simple finite dimensional complex Lie algebras is generalized to Lie subsuperalgebras of the general linear Lie superalgebras.

entry.title: Two kinds of duality
entry.summary: In a finite zone KdV context we show relations between the duality variables of Faraggi-Matone and those involved in Seiberg-Witten type duality.

author.name: Robert Carroll
author.arxiv:affiliation: Mathematics Dept., University of Illinois, Urbana, IL

entry.title: The Lorentz-Dirac Equation: One More Paradox of Preacceleration
entry.summary: One more paradox of classical Lorentz-Dirac preaccelerative solution is found: the formation of the event horizon.

entry.title: Some remarks on N=2 extended supersymmetric Yang-Mills theories and Seiberg-Witten duality
entry.summary: Talk presented at the 9th Max Born Symposion, Karpacz, September 1996

entry.title: The Lorentz-Dirac Equation: the Instability of "Physical" Solution
entry.summary: The instability of "physical" preaccelerative solution of the Lorentz-Dirac equation is explicitly shown

entry.title: Heterotic Strings from Matrices
entry.summary: We propose a nonperturbative definition of heterotic string theory on arbitrary multidimensional tori.

entry.title: Automorphic Forms, Bundles and Yang-Mills Equations
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by the author.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, TeX. The paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Time evolution in general gauge theories
entry.summary: Talk at the International Workshop "New Non Perturbative Methods and Quantization on the Light Cone", Les Houches, France, Feb.24-March 7, 1997

entry.title: Comment on "Scaling Hypothesis for the Spectral Densities in the Nonlinear Sigma Model"
entry.summary: We comment on the recent paper by Balog and Niedermaier [hep-th/9701156].

entry.title: A Course on: "An Algebraic Approach to Nonperturbative Quantum Field Theory"
entry.summary: The content of this paper is incorporated into hep-th/9805093

entry.title: BPS States in F-Theory
entry.summary: The spectra of BPS states in F-theory on elliptic fibred fourfolds are investigated.

entry.title: Symmetry Properties of Self-Dual Fields
entry.summary: We briefly review the structure and properties of self-dual field actions.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX file, 4 pages. Talk given at the Fifth International Wigner Symposium (Vienna, August 25-29, 1997)

entry.title: On Propagator of Notoph
entry.summary: It is shown that the notoph propagator in the noncovariant longitudinal gauge is equivalent to the covariant Feynmann - like propagator.

entry.title: Coincidences between M(atrix) Theory and Algebraic QFT?
entry.summary: The content of this paper is incorporated into hep-th/9805093

entry.title: On the relevance of the multiplicative anomaly
entry.summary: We shed doubt on a commonly used manipulation in computing the partition function for a matrix valued operator together with its attendant invocation of the multiplicative anomaly.

entry.title: Compactifications of F-Theory on Calabi-Yau Fourfolds
entry.summary: The enhanced gauge groups in F-theory compactified on elliptic Calabi-Yau fourfolds are investigated in terms of toric geometry.

entry.title: Matter in F-Theory
entry.summary: It is shown that the matter content of F-theory compactifications on elliptic Calabi-Yau threefolds is encoded in the Gromov-Witten invariants.

entry.title: Master Partitions for Large N Matrix Field Theories
entry.summary: We introduce a systematic approach for treating the large N limit of matrix field theories.

entry.title: Exact S-matrices
entry.summary: Notes on exact S-matrices in 1+1 dimensions, based on lectures given at the 1996 Eotvos Graduate School, Budapest, and at the Institut Henri Poincare, Paris.

entry.title: The Holographic Principle and the Renormalization Group
entry.summary: We prove a c-theorem for holographic theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTex,6 pages. Contribution to L. Bel's Festscrift

entry.title: Geometric Physics
entry.summary: Talk given at ICM '98, Berlin, reviewing some of the recent developments in understanding of string theory for a mathematical audience (to appear in Documenta Mathematica).

entry.title: D-Branes and Hilbert Schemes
entry.summary: The Nakamura's algorithm is applied to compute the Hilbert scheme for the D-brane model 1/13(1,2,10).

entry.title: Division Algebras: 26 Dimensions; 3 Families
entry.summary: The link of the Division Algebras to 10-dimensional spacetime and one leptoquark family is extended to 26-dimensional spacetime and three leptoquark families.

entry.title: Puzzles and Paradoxes About Holography
entry.summary: See hep-th/9903228.

entry.title: Neutral Particles and Super Schwinger Terms
entry.summary: Z_2-graded Schwinger terms for neutral particles in 1 and 3 space dimensions are considered.

entry.title: On the bracket problem in covariant Hamiltonian field theory
entry.summary: The polysymplectic phase space of covariant Hamiltonian field theory can be provided with the current algebra bracket.

entry.title: Speculations on AdS/CFT at all orders in 1/N
entry.summary: Paper withdrawn. The argument was based on a misconception

entry.title: Asymptotic behaviour of total cross sections in quantum field theory
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: On the Radiatively Induced CPT-Odd Term in QED
entry.summary: The paper has been temporarily withdrawn.

entry.title: Superconformal Algebras on the Boundary of AdS_3
entry.summary: See hep-th/0002188

entry.title: On the Rotating Charged BTZ Metric
entry.summary: It is shown that the charged non-diagonal BTZ (2+1)-spacetime is not a solution of the Einstein-Maxwell field equations with cosmological constant.

entry.title: Georgi-Goldstone realization of Chiral Symmetry in Quantum Chromodynamics
entry.summary: It is shown that quantum chromodynamics based on asymptotic freedom and confinement exhibits the vector mode of chiral symmetry conjectured by Georgi.

entry.title: Equilibrium and Non-equilibrium Quantum Field Theory
entry.summary: We concern with various aspects of equilibrium and non-equilibrium quantum field theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 196 pages LaTeX, 21 figures, PhD thesis at Cambridge University

entry.title: Propagators for massive symmetric tensor and p-forms in AdS(d+1)
entry.summary: We construct propagators in Euclidean AdS(d+1) space-time for massive p-forms and massive symmetric tensors.

entry.title: Asymptotic Zero Energy States for SU(N greater or equal 3)
entry.summary: Some ideas are presented concerning the question which of the harmonic wavefunctions constructed in [hep-th/9909191] may be annihilated by all supercharges.

entry.title: The Rest-Frame Instant Form of Dynamics and Dirac's Observables
entry.summary: Talk given at the International Workshop ``Physical Variables in Gauge Theories", Dubna 1999

entry.title: A Note on Singular Instantons
entry.summary: We point out the existence of some singular, radial, spin-0 instantons for curvature-quadratic gravity theories. They are complex.

entry.title: Poincare Anomaly in Planar Field Theory
entry.summary: We show the presence of Poincare anomaly in Maxwell-Chern-Simons theory with an explicit mass term, in 2+1-dimensions.

entry.title: Reply to comment on Casimir energy for spherical boundaries
entry.summary: It is shown that the recent criticism of Brevik et al. (hep-th/0004041) is in error.

entry.title: Aspects of Gauge Theory - Gravity Correspondence
entry.summary: A brief review of aspects of gravity gauge theory correspondance inspired by string theory is presented.

entry.title: A Remark on BRST Singlets
entry.summary: Negative norm Hilbert space state vectors can be BRST invariant, we show in a simplified Y-M model that such states can be created by starting with gluons only.

entry.title: Reminiscences
entry.summary: Reminiscences of Bunji Sakita.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published in "A Quest for Symmetry," Selected Works of Bunji Sakita. Eds.: Keiji Kikkawa, Miguel Virasoro, Spenta Wadia. Published by World Scientific

entry.title: Divergences in the Casimir energy
entry.summary: The divergence found by Nesterenko, Lambiase and Scarpetta in the Casimir energy on a semi-circular cylinder is attributed to the existence of edges.

entry.title: On the cohomological derivation of topological Yang-Mills theory
entry.summary: Topological Yang-Mills theory is derived in the framework of Lagrangian BRST cohomology.

entry.title: D-dimensional conformal sigma-models and their topological excitations
entry.summary: A talk presented at International Conference ICMP-2000, London, England

entry.title: Cartan tori and ADE classification of two-dimensional topological phase transitions
entry.summary: A talk presented at International Conference ICMP-2000, London, England

entry.title: Seiberg-Witten Theories, Integrable Models and Perturbative Prepotentials
entry.summary: This is a very brief review of relations between Seiberg-Witten theories and integrable systems with emphasis on the perturbative prepotentials presented at the E.S.Fradkin Memorial Conference.

entry.title: Why do we need supersymmetry?
entry.summary: These short (personal) notes appeared as the result of my attempt to address the question raised in the title.

entry.title: Gauge theories on noncommutative spaces
entry.summary: I review my results about noncommutative gauge theories and about the relation of these theories to M(atrix) theory following my lecture on ICMP 2000.

entry.title: Supersymmetry in Classical Mechanics
entry.summary: We briefly review the universal supersymmetry present in classical hamiltonian systems and show its applications to field theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: Review article submitted to the "Concise Encyclopaedia of Susy"

entry.title: Applications of Reflection Amplitudes in Toda-type Theories
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: N D0-branes and antibranes in the background independent string field theory
entry.summary: In this paper we extend our previous work hep-th/0102063 to the case D0-brane+antibrane system.

entry.title: D-branes and twisted K-theory
entry.summary: Topological charges of the $D6$-brane in the presence of a Neveu-Schwarz B-field are computed by methods of twisted $K$-theory.

entry.title: Non-abelian self-duality from self-interaction
entry.summary: The non-abelian self-dual action in three dimensions is derived using the self-interaction mechanism.

entry.title: Renormalization by enforcing a symmetry
entry.summary: A new renormalization scheme for theories with nontrivial internal symmetry is proposed. The scheme is regularization independent and respects the symmetry requirements.

entry.title: Comments on fluxes and Chern numbers in non-commutative gauge theories
entry.summary: Withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: The world sheet revisited
entry.summary: We investigate the mathematical structure of the world sheet in two-dimensional conformal field theories.

entry.title: Introduction to string field theory
entry.summary: The 1988 book, now free, with corrections and bookmarks (for pdf).

author.name: W. Siegel
author.arxiv:affiliation: C.N. Yang Institute for Theoretical Physics

entry.title: Intersecting delocalized p-branes
entry.summary: A model considered in the paper generalizes supergravity type model to the case of delocalized membrane sources. A generalization of intersecting p-brane solution with delocalized membranes is presented.

entry.title: Supersymmetries and Gauge Natural Theories
entry.summary: We discuss the gauge natural formulation of supersymmetric theories and supergravity, with the aim to show that the standard and the supersymmetric frameworks admit in fact a unifying mathematical language.

entry.title: Lessons from Numerical Analysis
entry.summary: It is reviewed how Renormalization Group, species doubling and CKM mixing are known to appear in numerical analysis: Butcher group, parasitic solutions and higher order methods

entry.title: Black Crunch
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Some Solutions of Berkovits' Superstring Field Theory
entry.summary: In this note we construct exact solution of Berkovits'superstring field theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, new first page, typos corrected, acknowledgement added

entry.title: Deformation quantization in covariant Hamiltonian field theory
entry.summary: The deformation star product of smooth functions on the momentum phase space of covariant (polysymplectic) Hamiltonian field theory is introduced.

entry.title: Energy-momentum conservation laws in gauge theory with broken gauge symmetries
entry.summary: If a Lagrangian of gauge theory of internal symmetries is not gauge-invariant, the energy-momentum fails to be conserved in general.

entry.title: Twenty Years of Debate with Stephen
entry.summary: This is my contribution to Stephen Hawking's 60th birthday party. Happy Birthday Stephen!

entry.title: Around Poincare duality, in discrete spaces
entry.summary: We walk out the landscape of K-theoretic Poincare Duality for finite algebras. It paves the way to get continuum Dirac operators from discrete noncommutative manifolds.

entry.title: PP-WAVES (the original article)
entry.summary: PP-waves have recently been of interest to string theorists. This is the original, hard to find, original article on plane polarized gravitational waves.

entry.title: Superwaves
entry.summary: We give some supersymmetric wave solutions, both chiral (selfdual) and nonchiral, to interacting supersymmetric theories in four dimensions.

entry.title: Is There a Problem with Quantum Gravitation?
entry.summary: We argue that Quantum Gravitation forces us to sum over metrics of all signatures.

entry.title: Introduction to String Theory
entry.summary: We give a pedagogical introduction to string theory, D-branes and p-brane solutions.

entry.title: Time Dependent Solution in Open Bosonic String Field Theory
entry.summary: In this paper we present time dependent solution of the open bosonic string field theory describing the motion of the tachyon on unstable D-brane.

entry.title: The Jordanian Bicovariant Differential Calculus
entry.summary: We show that the Woronowicz prescription using a bimodule constructed out of a tensorial product of a bimodule and its conjugate and a bi-coinvariant singlet leads to a trivial differential calculus.

entry.title: Perturbative Derivation of Mirror Symmetry
entry.summary: We provide a purely perturbative (one loop) derivation of mirror symmetry for supersymmetric sigma models in two dimensions.

entry.title: The Projection Conditions and Discrete Torsion for C^3/Z_3xZ_3
entry.summary: This work has been withdrawn.

entry.title: D-Branes and Derived Categories
entry.summary: The digest of ideology interpreting D-branes on Calabi-Yau manifolds as objects of the derived category is given.

entry.title: Chain Structure in Symplectic Analysis of a Constrained System
entry.summary: We show that the constraint structure in the chain by chain method can be investigated within the symplectic analysis of Faddeev-Jackiw formalism.

entry.title: Domain Wall Solutions
entry.summary: I describe domain walls and domain wall lattices in non-Abelian models.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages. Lectures at NATO ASI ``Patterns of symmetry breaking'', Cracow, September 2002

entry.title: Rolling Tachyon and Fields on the Brane
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: Real, p-Adic and Adelic Noncommutative Scalar Solitons
entry.summary: We considered real, p-adic and adelic noncommutative scalar solitons and obtained some new results.

entry.title: Spacetime diffeomorphisms and the geodesic approximation
entry.summary: We present a spacetime diffeomorphism invariant formulation of the geodesic approximation to soliton dynamics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, contribution to the proceedings of the Cargese 2002 Summer School

entry.title: On 't Hooft's loop operator
entry.summary: An explicit realization of 't Hooft's loop operator in continuum Yang-Mills theory is given.

entry.title: The infrared R* - operation
entry.summary: We describe the infrared R-operation for subtraction of infrared divergencies in Feynman diagrams

entry.title: Conformal Symmetry and Triviality
entry.summary: We study examples where conformal invariance implies triviality of the underlying quantum field theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, Plaintex, few sentences and three references added

entry.title: Comment on `Must a Hamiltonian be hermitian'
entry.summary: A small comment on the paper with the mentioned title by Carl M. Bender, Dorje C. Brody and Hugh F. Jones.

entry.title: Positronium in intense laser fields
entry.summary: The dynamics and radiation of positronium is investigated in intense laser fields.

entry.title: Acausality of Massive Charged Spin 2 Fields
entry.summary: The recent claim in hep-th/0302225 that, contrary to all previous work, massive charged s=2 fields propagate causally is false.

entry.title: Self-dual quaternionic lumps in octonionic space-time
entry.summary: The theory of self-dual bosonic lumps immersed in the Cayley-calibrated space of octonions has a large class of exact finite quaternionic power series solutions.

entry.title: Krein structure of supersymmetry
entry.summary: We present supersymmetric positive definite scalar products together with natural Krein structures of supersymmetries.

entry.title: Response to `Comments on the U(2) ADHM two-instanton'
entry.summary: We respond to `Comments on the U(2) ADHM two-instanton' [Y. Tian, Phys. Lett. B 566 (2003) 183].

entry.title: An approach to supertopology
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn because of serious errors.

entry.title: Exact solutions of the relativistic many-body problem
entry.summary: Exact solutions of the relativistic many-body problem are presented

entry.title: Stringy gravity at short distances
entry.summary: Analysis of string interactions indicates a weakening of gravity at the string length scale, thus avoiding black holes and their singularities.

entry.title: A Map between (q,h)-deformed Gauge Theories and ordinary Gauge Theories
entry.summary: We introduce a new map between a (q,h)-deformed gauge theory and ordinary gauge theory in a full analogy with Seiberg-Witten map.

entry.title: Complete global embedding structures of various black holes
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: Snyderspace
entry.summary: We generalize the construction of Snyder to a Lorentz covariant noncommutative superspace.

entry.title: On the Four-Color-Map Theorem
entry.summary: Coloring planar Feynman diagrams in spinor quantum electrodynamics, is a non trivial model soluble without computer. Four colors are necessary and sufficient.

entry.title: A Nonperturbative Calculation of the Electron's Magnetic Moment
entry.summary: I shall present nonperturbative calculations of the electron's magnetic moment using the light-cone representation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages; Light Cone Physics: Hadrons and Beyond

entry.title: The Emergence of Anticommuting Coordinates and the Dirac-Ramond-Kostant operators
entry.summary: The history of anticommuting coordinates is decribed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, Contribution to the Proceedings of The Gunnar Nordstr\"om Symposium on Theoretical Physics - The Physics of Extra Dimensions

entry.title: Spinning membranes on $AdS_p\times S^q$
entry.summary: Minimal Surfaces in $S^3$ are shown to yield spinning membrane solutions in $AdS_4\times S^7$.

entry.title: Supersymmetry in 1-dimensional systems
entry.summary: Various aspects of Supersymmetry in 1-dimensional systems are analyzed.

entry.title: Cosmic Natural Selection
entry.summary: I make a number of comments about Smolin's theory of Cosmic Natural Selection.

entry.title: Quantum Nonabelian Monopoles
entry.summary: We discuss quantum mechanical and topological aspects of nonabelian monopoles. Related recent results on nonabelian vortices are also mentioned.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex 13 pages, 2 figures, Talk at "Continuous Advances in QCD 2004", Univ. Minnesota, May 2004

entry.title: Deformed Coordinate Spaces; Derivatives
entry.summary: Lecture given at BW2003 Workshop "Mathematical, Theoretical and Phenomenological Challenges Beyond Standard Model" 29 August-02 September, 2003 Vrnjacka Banja, Serbia

entry.title: Quantum Field Theory: Spin Zero
entry.summary: This is a draft version of Part I of a three-part textbook on quantum field theory.

entry.title: Quantum Field Theory: Spin One Half
entry.summary: This is a draft version of Part II of a three-part textbook on quantum field theory.

entry.title: Quantum Supersymmetric Ghosts
entry.summary: We work out the quantization of the massless vector field by introducing quantum supersymmetric ghosts. We prove positivity in the physical Fock space.

entry.title: Perturbative renormalization and BRST
entry.summary: The perturbative quantization of gauge theories is shortly reviewed with emphasis of the local operator BRST-formalism.
entry.arxiv:comment: Written on request of the 'Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics'

entry.title: Space-time BRST symmetries
entry.summary: Bearing in mind BV quantization of gauge gravitation theory, we extend general covariant transformations to the BRST ones.

entry.title: Challenges of Matrix Models
entry.summary: Brief review of concepts and unsolved problems in the theory of matrix models.

entry.title: Notes on correlation functions in (0,2) theories
entry.summary: In this note we shall review recent work on generalizing rational curve counting to perturbative heterotic theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, LaTeX, contribution to proceedings of Snowbird conference on string geometry, June 2004

entry.title: Long strings condensation and FZZT branes
entry.summary: We propose a matrix model description of extended D-branes in 2D noncritical string

entry.title: Classical Non-Local conserved charges in String Theory
entry.summary: We construct a conserved non local charge in $AdS_5\times S_5$ string theory.

entry.title: Superconducting Semilocal Strings
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: Comment on 'Schwarzschild Black Hole in Noncommutative Spaces'
entry.summary: A brief comment on the paper hep-th/0508051 (with the title mentioned above) by F. Nasseri.

entry.title: 2D conformal field theory and vertex operator algebras
entry.summary: This article will appear in the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics (Elsevier, 2006).

entry.title: Asymptotically Free $φ^4$ in 3+1
entry.summary: We demonstrate that regularization with higher derivatives in 3+1 Minkowski space leads to an asymptotically free theory of interacting scalar field.

entry.title: C^{2} formulation of Euler fluid
entry.summary: The Hamiltonian formalism for the continuous media is constructed using the representation of Euler variables in $\mathcal{C}^{2}\times \infty$ phase space.

entry.title: Beyond Space-Time
entry.summary: These notes, based on the remarks made at the 23 Solvay Conference, collect several speculative ideas concerning gauge/ strings duality, de Sitter spaces, dimensionality and the cosmological constant.

entry.title: Trefoil Solitons, Elementary Fermions, and SU_q(2)
entry.summary: By utilizing the gauge invariance of the SU_q(2) algebra we sharpen the basis of the q-knot phenomenology.

entry.title: Probabilities in the landscape
entry.summary: I review recent progress in defining probability distributions in the inflationary multiverse.
entry.arxiv:comment: Discussion in Sec. IV.A corrected and clarified

entry.title: Understanding the landscape
entry.summary: Based on comments made at the 23rd Solvay Conference, December 2005, Brussels.

entry.title: Unitarity, nonlocality, and black hole information
entry.summary: Replaced by major revision hep-th/0605196

entry.title: Multisoliton solution of 3-waves problem
entry.summary: Multi-soliton solution of the 3-waves problem is represented in explicit determinative form.

entry.title: On Zamolodchikov's Periodicity Conjecture
entry.summary: I prove Zamolodchikov's periodicity conjecture for type A with both ranks arbitrary.

entry.title: Geometric twist decomposition off the light--cone for nonlocal QCD operators
entry.summary: A general procedure is introduced allowing for the infinite decomposition of nonlocal operators off the light--cone into operators of definite geometric twist.

entry.title: Trying to understand mass
entry.summary: We try to understand how particles acquire mass in general, and in particular, how they acquire mass in the standard model and beyond.

entry.title: Homage to Ettore Majorana
entry.summary: Homage is paid to E. Majorana by dedicating our recent work in his memory.

entry.title: Note on the structure of constraint algebras
entry.summary: It is shown that when the gauge algebra is with root system the canonical Hamiltonian commutes with the constraints. Two other simple propositions concerning gauge fixing are proved too.

entry.title: Quantization and holomorphic anomaly
entry.summary: We study wave functions of B-model on a Calabi-Yau threefold in various polarizations.

entry.title: Rotations and Statistics
entry.summary: The way a field transforms under rotations determines its statistics--as is easy to see for scalar, Dirac, and vector fields.
entry.arxiv:comment: A 13-page pedagogical paper inspired by an old remark of Wigner's

entry.title: Lorentz Covariant Distributions with the Spectral Conditions
entry.summary: The Lorentz covariant tempered disributions with the supports in the product of the closed upper light cones are described.

entry.title: Reply to Comment by J.A.Garcia, arXiv:0705.0143 (to appear in PRD)
entry.summary: We observe that there is no clash between the works \cite{gar} and \cite{g1}.

entry.title: Free motion in deformed (quantum) four-dimensional space
entry.summary: It is shown that trajectories of free motion of the particles in deformed ("quantum") four dimensional space-time are quadratic curves.

entry.title: Noncommutative Minisuperspace Cosmology
entry.summary: We consider the noncommutative minisuperspace classical and quantum cosmologies.

entry.title: On the Quantum Origin of Structure in the Inflationary Universe
entry.summary: In this lecture I give a pedagogical introduction to inflationary cosmology with a special focus on the quantum generation of cosmological perturbations.

entry.title: General (anti-)commutators of gamma matrices
entry.summary: Commutators and anticommutators of gamma matrices with arbitrary numbers of (antisymmetrized) indices are derived.

entry.title: Challenges to Path Integral Formulations of Quantum Theories
entry.summary: The functional integral has many triumphs in elucidating quantum theory. But incorporating charge fractionalization into that formalism remains a challenge.

entry.title: Target Space Duality III: Potentials
entry.summary: We generalize previous results on target space duality to the case where there are background fields and the sigma model lagrangian has a potential function.

entry.title: Relativistic Quantum Coulomb Law
entry.summary: The relativistic quantum mechanics equations for the electromagnetic interaction are propososed.

entry.title: Betrachtungen jenseits des Standardmodells der Teilchenphysik
entry.summary: Gravity with incorporation of additional dimensions and noncommutative geometry.

entry.title: Abelian solutions of the KP equation
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of abelian solutions of KP equations and show that all of them are algebro-geometric.

entry.title: On the class of chiral symmetry representations with scalar and pseudoscalar fields
entry.summary: In the following few pages an account is given of a theme, which I began in 1966 and followed to the present.

entry.title: Introduction to String Theory
entry.summary: The aim of these notes is to give recent developments in string theory. In particular, we discuss the string spectrums, compactifications, brane physics and dualities.

entry.title: Dilatation operator in 3d
entry.summary: The perturbative dilatation operator in 3d is constructed at the leading two-loop order.

entry.title: Personnal recollections about the birth of string theory
entry.summary: Invited contribution to the collective book "The Birth of String Theory"

entry.title: A solution manual for Polchinski's "String Theory"
entry.summary: We present detailed solutions to 81 of the 202 problems in J. Polchinski's two-volume textbook "String Theory".

entry.title: The core Hopf algebra
entry.summary: We study the core Hopf algebra underlying the renormalization Hopf algebra.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9p, contributed to the Proceedings for Alain Connes' 60th birthday

entry.title: Characterizing Planar Graphs
entry.summary: Cataloging planar diagrams using the depth concept is proposed.

entry.title: Deriving particle physics from quantum gravity: a plan
entry.summary: I give a short review of the holographic approach to quantum gravity, with emphasis on its application to deriving the properties of elementary particles.

entry.title: Three Etudes in QFT
entry.summary: We review QFT from the algebraic structure of its perturbative expansion and point out three new results.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6p, contribution to the Int. Congress Math. Phys., Prague 2009

entry.title: Solving field equations in spinor electrodynamics
entry.summary: Solutions of classical and quantum equations of motion in spinor electrodynamics are constructed within the context of perturbation theory. The solutions possess a graphical representation in terms of diagrams.

entry.title: Lagrangian with U(1)-SU(2) mixing
entry.summary: Principal axis transformation is performed for a Lagrangian with a U(1)-SU(2) mixing term, that can cause a SU(2) deconfining transition.

entry.title: Curved Space (Matrix) Membranes
entry.summary: Hamiltonian formulations of M-branes moving in curved backgrounds are given.

entry.title: Algebraic Structures in local QFT
entry.summary: A review of the Hodge and Hopf-algebraic approach to QFT.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6p, talk given at Loops and Legs 2010

entry.title: Matrix Models and Lorentz Invariance
entry.summary: The question of Lorentz invariance in the membrane matrix model is addressed

entry.title: Simplifying Local BRST Cohomology Calculation via Spectral Sequence
entry.summary: We simplify some crucial calculations in \cite{1} by using the technique of spectral sequence of a double complex.

entry.title: M-brane dynamical symmetry and quantization
entry.summary: The recently discovered dynamical symmetry for relativistic extended objects is derived from first principles, and analogues commutators are obtained for the corresponding formal quantum expressions

entry.title: Linear Confinement of Quarks from Supergravity
entry.summary: A supergravity background that produces linear confinement of quarks in four dimensions is presented.

entry.title: Pulsating Strings in Deformed Backgrounds
entry.summary: This is a brief summary on pulsating strings in beta deformed backgrounds found recently.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages. Talk presented at Quantum Theory and Symmetries 7, Prague, August 7-13, 2011

entry.title: Conformal Bootstrap in Three Dimensions?
entry.summary: We discuss an idea of how 3D critical exponents can be determined by Conformal Field Theory techniques.

entry.title: The Kreuzer bi-homomorphism
entry.summary: This is a brief review of simple current techniques and their application to string theory constructions, centered around Max Kreuzer's contribution to this field

entry.title: Using the Renormalization Group
entry.summary: Various uses of the renormalization group are examined.

entry.title: Was There a Beginning?
entry.summary: In this note I respond to Vilenkin's claim that there must have been a beginning.

entry.title: Influence of Kaluza Scalar on the Raychaudhuri Equation
entry.summary: It is shown that the influence of Kaluza scalar is to induce expansion in the Raychaudhuri equation for two representative solutions of the Kaluza theory.

entry.title: SuSy: The Early Years (1966-1976)
entry.summary: We describe the early evolution of theories with fermion-boson symmetry
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the special issue of the EPJ C journal entitled "SUSY after the Higgs discovery"

entry.title: Boundary F-maximization
entry.summary: We discuss a variant of the F-theorem and F-maximization principles which applies to (super)conformal boundary conditions of 4d (S)CFTs.

entry.title: Zero modes for the quantum Liouville model
entry.summary: The problem of definition of zero modes for quantum Liouville model is discussed and corresponding Hilbert space representation is constructed.

entry.title: Determinant for the Coulomb potential on the three-sphere
entry.summary: The functional determinant for a Coulomb potential (or mass squared) on a three-sphere is computed numerically.

entry.title: Covariant Structure Constants for Deformed Oscillator Algebra
entry.summary: $sl_2$-covariant expressions for structure constants of the associative algebra of deformed oscillators $Aq\left(2,\nu\right)$ are obtained.

entry.title: Uniform Gauge for D1-brane in General Background
entry.summary: We construct uniform gauge D1-brane action in general background. We also discuss how this action transforms under double Wick rotation and determine transformation properties of background fields.

entry.title: Electromagnetic Memory
entry.summary: An elementary derivation of the electromagnetic memory effect is given. An experimental setup to detect it is suggested.

entry.title: Canonical transformations and minimal length
entry.summary: We show how to modify the canonical transformations to make them compatible with non-commutative Poisson brackets.

entry.title: Quasi-Static BMN Solutions
entry.summary: Classical solutions of membrane equations that were recently identified as limits of matrix-solutions are looked upon from another angle

entry.title: Holographic relations in loop quantum gravity
entry.summary: It is shown that a relation between entropy and minimal area holds in loop quantum gravity, reminiscent of the Ryu-Takayanagi relation.

entry.title: Lectures on Inflation
entry.summary: Planning to explore the beginning of the Universe? A lightweight introductory guide to the theory of Inflation.

entry.title: Dirac oscillator and minimal length
entry.summary: We show how to solve the Dirac oscillator with a minimal length by using previous results on the harmonic oscillator in a Snyder algebra.

entry.title: A possibility to describe models of nonabelian massive gauge fields in the framework of renormalizable theory
entry.summary: Renormalizable theory of massive nonabelian gauge fields, which does not require the existence of observable scalar fields is proposed.

entry.title: Dual Scale Invariance Spontaneous Symmetry Breaking and Turbulence
entry.summary: We discuss spontaneous symmetry breaking of dual (space and time) scale invariance in the context of turbulence.

entry.title: On integrability of 2-dimensional $σ$-models of Poisson-Lie type
entry.summary: We describe a simple procedure for constructing a Lax pair for suitable 2-dimensional $\sigma$-models appearing in Poisson-Lie T-duality

entry.title: Hamiltonian construction of W-gravity actions
entry.summary: We show that all W-gravity actions can be easilly constructed and understood from the point of view of the Hamiltonian formalism for the constrained systems. This formalism also gives a method of constructing gauge invariant actions for arbitrary conformally extended algebras.

entry.title: Supersymmetric Gelfand-Dickey Algebra
entry.summary: We study the classical version of supersymmetric $W$-algebras. Using the second Gelfand-Dickey Hamiltonian structure we work out in detail $W_2$ and $W_3$-algebras.

entry.title: Differential Equations for Periods and Flat Coordinates in Two Dimensionsional Topological Matter Theories
entry.summary: We derive directly from the N=2 LG superpotential the differential equations that determine the flat coordinates of arbitrary topological CFT's.

entry.title: String Theory in Two Dimensions
entry.summary: I review some of the recent progress in two-dimensional string theory, which is formulated as a sum over surfaces embedded in one dimension.
entry.arxiv:comment: 76 pages, Phyzzx, lectures at the 1991 ICTP Spring School; v2: postscript figures included

entry.title: String Theory and the Donaldson Polynomial
entry.summary: It is shown that the scattering of spacetime axions with fivebrane solitons of heterotic string theory at zero momentum is proportional to the Donaldson polynomial.

entry.title: Superstring in Two Dimensional Black Hole
entry.summary: We construct superstring theory in two dimensional black hole background based on supersymmetric $SU(1,1)/U(1)$ gauged Wess-Zumino-Witten model.

entry.title: Ashtekar's Approach to Quantum Gravity
entry.summary: A review is given of work by Abhay Ashtekar and his colleagues Carlo Rovelli, Lee Smolin, and others, which is directed at constructing a nonperturbative quantum theory of general relativity.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: In Strings and Symmetries 1991, World Scientific (1992)

entry.title: Is S=1 for c=1?
entry.summary: The $c=1$ string in the Liouville field theory approach is shown to possess a nontrivial tree-level $S$-matrix which satisfies factorization property implied by unitary, if all the extra massive physical states are included.

entry.title: Singular vectors by Fusions in affine su(2)
entry.summary: Explicit expressions for the singular vectors in the highest weight representations of $A_1^{(1)}$ are obtained using the fusion formalism of conformal field theory.

entry.title: Quantum Symmetries in 2D Massive Field Theories
entry.summary: We review various aspects of (infinite) quantum group symmetries in 2D massive quantum field theories. We discuss how these symmetries can be used to exactly solve the integrable models. A possible way for generalizing to three dimensions is shortly described.

entry.title: Quantum Gravity and String Theory, What Have We Learned?
entry.summary: This is a non-technical talk given at the Sixth Marcel Grossman Meeting on General Relativity, Kyoto, Japan in June 1991. Some developments in string theory over the last six years are discussed together with their qualitative implications for issues in quantum gravity.

entry.title: Correlators of Special States in c=1 Liouville Theory
entry.summary: We generalize the ground ring structure to all special BRST invariant operators in the right branch in the c=1 Liouville theory. We also discuss correlation functions of special states on the sphere.

entry.title: Correlation Functions of Local Operators in 2D Gravity Coupled to Minimal Matter
entry.summary: Recent advances are being discussed on the calculation, within the conformal field theory approach, of the correlation functions for local operators in the theory of 2D gravity coupled to the minimal models of matter.

entry.title: BRST Analysis of Physical States for 2D (Super) Gravity Coupled to (Super) Conformal Matter
entry.summary: We summarize some recent results on the BRST analysis of physical states of 2D gravity coupled to c<=1 conformal matter and the supersymmetric generalization.

entry.title: Anomaly-free $W$-gravity Theories
entry.summary: We give a review of some recent developments in the quantisation of $W$-gravity theories. In particular, we discuss the construction of anomaly-free $W_\infty$ and $W_3$ gravities.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages (Contribution to the proceedings of the "Strings and Symmetries" meeting, Stony Brook, May 1991.)

entry.title: Hard Art of the Universe Creation
entry.summary: We develop a stochastic approach to the theory of tunneling with the baby universe formation. This method is applied also to the theory of creation of the universe in a laboratory.

entry.title: Some Properties of (Non) Critical Strings
entry.summary: We review some recent developments in string theory, emphasizing the importance of vacuum instabilities, their relation to the density of states, and the role of space-time fermions in non-critical string theory. We also discuss the classical dynamics of two dimensional string theory.

entry.title: Heterotic instantons and solitons in anomaly-free supergravity
entry.summary: We extend the classical heterotic instanton solutions to all orders in $\alpha'$ using the equations of anomaly-free supergravity, and discuss the relation between these equations and the string theory $\beta$-functions.

entry.title: The Covariant W_3 Action
entry.summary: Starting from SL(3,R) Chern-Simons theory we derive the covariant action for W_3 gravity.

entry.title: N=2 Coset Compactifications with Non-Diagonal Invariants
entry.summary: We consider 4-dimensional string models obtained by tensoring N=2 coset theories with non-diagonal modular invariants. We present results from a systematic analysis including moddings by discrete symmetries.

entry.title: W-Algebra Symmetries of Generalised Drinfel'd-Sokolov Hierarchies
entry.summary: Using the zero-curvature formulation, it is shown that W-algebra transformations are symmetries of corresponding generalised Drinfel'd-Sokolov hierarchies. This result is illustrated with the examples of the KdV and Boussinesque hierarchies, and the hierarchy associated to the Polyakov-Bershadsky W-algebra.

entry.title: Matrix Models at Finite N
entry.summary: We summarize some aspects of matrix models from the approaches directly based on their properties at finite N.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages (based on the talk given at the conference ``Strings and Symmetries 1991'' at Stony Brook, May 20-25, 1991.)

entry.title: On Black Holes In String Theory
entry.summary: In these lecture notes from Strings `91, I briefly sketch the analogy between two dimensional black holes and the s-wave sector of four dimensional black holes, and the physical interest of the latter, particularly in the magnetically charged case.

entry.title: C.S.Xiong
entry.summary: We generalize Toda--like integrable lattice systems to non--symmetric case. We show that they possess the bi--Hamiltonian structure.

entry.title: Integrability of the quantum KdV equation at c = -2
entry.summary: We present a simple a direct proof of the complete integrability of the quantum KdV equation at $c=-2$, with an explicit description of all the conservation laws.

entry.title: Bicovariant Differential Calculus on the Quantum D=2 Poincare Group
entry.summary: We present a bicovariant differential calculus on the quantum Poincare group in two dimensions. Gravity theories on quantum groups are discussed.

entry.title: Addendum to the paper "Combinatorics of the modular group II: the Kontsevich integrals"
entry.summary: Addendum to the paper Combinatorics of the Modular Group II The Kontsevich integrals, hep-th/9201001, by C. Itzykson and J.-B. Zuber (3 pages)

entry.title: Exact S-Matrices for Nonsimply-Laced Affine Toda Theories
entry.summary: We derive exact, factorized, purely elastic scattering matrices for affine Toda theories based on the nonsimply-laced Lie algebras and superalgebras.

entry.title: Comments on Gauged WZW Models
entry.summary: Some remarks are made about free anomaly groups in gauged WZW models. Considering a quite general action, anomaly cancellation is analyzed. The possibility of gauging left and right sectors independently in some cases is remarked. In particular Toda theories can be seen as such a kind of models.

entry.title: The two-dimensional O(3) nonlinear $σ$-model at finite temperature
entry.summary: We present a direct derivation of the thermodynamic integral equations of the O(3) nonlinear $\sigma$-model in two dimensions.

entry.title: W-Infinity and String Theory
entry.summary: We review some recent developments in the theory of $W_\infty$. We comment on its relevance to lower-dimensional string theory.

entry.title: Matrix model with superconformal symmetry
entry.summary: A matrix model is presented which leads to the discrete ``eigenvalue model'' proposed recently by Alvarez-Gaum\'e {\it et.al.} for 2D supergravity (coupled to superconformal matters).

entry.title: Chiral Current Algebras in Three--Dimensional Bf--Theory with Boundary
entry.summary: We consider the three--dimensional BF--model with planar boundary in the axial gauge. We find two--dimensional conserved chiral currents living on the boundary and satisfying Kac--Moody algebras.

entry.title: A note on the Zakharov-Shabat topological model
entry.summary: In this note I discuss some features of the topological theory obtained from the Zakharov-Shabat (or general sl(2,C)) hierarchy, and comment on some possible physical and/or mathematical interpretations of it.

entry.title: Relating Scattering Amplitudes in Bosonic and Topological String Theories
entry.summary: A formal relationship between scattering amplitudes in critical bosonic string theory and correlation functions of operators in topological string theory is found.

entry.title: $W_\infty$ and Anomalies of Self-Dual Einstein Theories
entry.summary: This manuscripts corrects some minor error in the paper, Mod. Phys. Lett. A 6 1893 (1991)

entry.title: Finite W-algebras
entry.summary: Finite versions of W-algebras are introduced by considering (symplectic) reductions of finite dimensional simple Lie algebras. In particular a finite analogue of $W^{(2)}_3$ is introduced and studied in detail. Its unitary and non-unitary, reducible and irreducible highest weight representations are constructed.

entry.title: 2+1 Gravity without dynamics
entry.summary: A three dimensional generally covariant theory is described that has a 2+1 canonical decomposition in which the Hamiltonian constraint, which generates the dynamics, is absent. Physical observables for the theory are described and the classical and quantum theories are compared with ordinary 2+1 gravity.

entry.title: A Continuum Description of Super-Calogero Models
entry.summary: An investigation is made of the super-Calogero model with particular emphasis on its continuum formulation and possible application in the context of supersymmetrizing the bosonic collective d=1 string field theory.

entry.title: Perturbation Theory for Antisymmetric Tensor Fields in Four Dimensions
entry.summary: Perturbation theory for a class of topological field theories containing antisymmetric tensor fields is considered. These models are characterized by a supersymmetric structure which allows to establish their perturbative finiteness.

entry.title: Reality in the Differential Calculus on q-euclidean Spaces
entry.summary: The nonlinear reality structure of the derivatives and the differentials for the euclidean q-spaces are found. A real Laplacian is constructed and reality properties of the exterior derivative are given.

entry.title: A Proposal for $D>1$ Strings?
entry.summary: Using the reduced formulation of large-N Quantum Field Theories we study strings in space-time dimensions higher than one. Some preliminary results concerning the possible string susceptibilities and general properties of the model are presented.

entry.title: Two-loop finiteness of D=2 supergravity
entry.summary: We establish two-loop (on shell) finiteness of certain supergravity theories in two dimensions. Possible implications of this result are discussed

entry.title: Cohomological Partition Functions for a Class of Bosonic Theories
entry.summary: We argue, that for a general class of nontrivial bosonic theories the path integral can be related to an equivariant generalization of conventional characteristic classes.

entry.title: Hidden Kac-Moody symmetry and 2D Quantum Supergravity
entry.summary: We examine the relation between Polyakov's formulation of two dimensional supergravity and gauged Wess-Zumino-Novikov-Witten models.

entry.title: Wormholes and Supersymmetry
entry.summary: Revisions: reference added to: G. Gilbert, {\sl Nucl.Phys.} {\bf B328}, 159 (1989)

entry.title: A New Construction of the Penner Model
entry.summary: The free energy of the Penner model is shown to be closely related to the integral over the two diagonalizing unitary matrices of a complex rectangular matrix.

entry.title: The D=1 Matrix Model and the Renormalization Group
entry.summary: We compute the critical exponents of $d = 1$ string theory to leading order, using the renormalization group approach recently suggested by Br\'{e}zin and Zinn-Justin.

entry.title: Vect(N) conformal fields and their exterior derivatives
entry.summary: Conformal fields are a recently discovered class of representations of the algebra of vector fields in $N$ dimensions. Invariant first-order differential operators (exterior derivatives) for conformal fields are constructed.

entry.title: Integrable N=2 Supersymmetric Field Theories
entry.summary: Some additional references are included on the last 3 pages.

entry.title: Models with Quantum Symmetry and their Spectra
entry.summary: We review how to construct a large class of integrable quantum spin chains with quantum-algebra symmetry, and how to determine their spectra. (To appear in Louis Witten Festschrift)

entry.title: Gravitationally Collapsing Dust in $(2+1)$ Dimensions
entry.summary: We investigate the circumstances under which gravitationally collapsing dust can form a black hole in three-dimensional spacetime.

entry.title: Diffeomorphism group and conformal fields
entry.summary: Conformal fields are a new class of $Vect(N)$ modules which are more general than tensor fields. The corresponding diffeomorphism group action is constructed. Conformal fields are thus invariantly defined.

entry.title: Free Field Representation of Quantum Affine Algebra U_q(\hat{sl}_2)
entry.summary: A Fock representation of the quantum affine algebra $U_q(\widehat{\sl}_2)$ is constructed by three bosonic fields for an arbitrary level with the help of the Drinfeld realization.

entry.title: Non-perturbative interactions in string theory
entry.summary: New non-perturbative interactions in the effective action of two dimensional string theory are described. These interactions are due to ``stringy" instantons
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, double coulumn Latex, 3 figures not included available as eps files on request, UPR-524T

entry.title: Integrable Systems and Classification of 2-dimensional Topological Field Theories
entry.summary: Misprints in the definition of semiclassical tau-function and in the formulae (3.40b) and (4.20) are corrected.

entry.title: Extrinsic Geometry Sensitive Bosonic String Theory
entry.summary: A modified rigid string theory with infrared behaviour governed by a nontrivial fixed point is presented.

entry.title: A Note on Representations of the $w_\infty$ Algebra
entry.summary: We explicitly demonstrate that the unitary representations of the $w_\infty$ algebra and its truncations are just the unitary representations of the Virasoro algebra.

entry.title: Self-Duality and the KdV Hierarchy
entry.summary: We derive the entire KdV hierarchy as well as the recursion relations from the self-duality condition on gauge fields in four dimensions.

entry.title: Local symmetry in the Kazakov-Migdal gauge model
entry.summary: The spectrum of observables in the induced lattice gauge model proposed recently by V.A.Kazakov and A.A.Migdal obeys the local-confinement selection rule. The underlying local continuous symmetry cannot be spontaneously broken within the model.

entry.title: The phase space of the Wess-Zumino-Witten model
entry.summary: We prove that the covariant and Hamiltonian phase spaces of the Wess-Zumino-Witten model on the cylinder are diffeomorphic and we derive the Poisson brackets of the theory.

entry.title: Critical Wilson Lines in Toroidal Compactifications of Heteroric Strings
entry.summary: Critical values of Wilson lines and general background fields for toroidal compactifications of heterotic string theories are constructed systematically using Dynkin diagrams.

entry.title: Current Algebras in $3+1$ dimensions
entry.summary: Aspects of a generalized representation theory of current algebras in $3+1$ dimensions are discussed in terms of the Fock bundle method, the sesquilinear form approach (of Langmann and Ruijsenaars), and Hilbert space cocycles.
entry.arxiv:comment: talk given at the XIX Internat. Colloq. on Group Theoretical Methods in Physics, Salamanca, July 1992, 4 pages

entry.title: Comment on Internal Frame Dragging and a Global Analog of the Aharonov-Bohm Effect
entry.summary: It is shown that AB-like cross sections can be obtained from symmetry breaking which does not require infinite energy, angular dependence in the symmetry breaking term, or a nontrivial $Z_2$ charge.

entry.title: Virasoro Representations on Fusion Graphs
entry.summary: For any non-unitary model with central charge c(2,q) the path spaces associated to a certain fusion graph are isomorphic to the irreducible Virasoro highest weight modules.

entry.title: Green-Schwarz Formulation of Self-Dual Superstring
entry.summary: The self-dual superstring has been described previously in a Neveu-Schwarz-Ramond formulation with local N=2 or 4 world-sheet supersymmetry. We present a Green-Schwarz-type formulation, with manifest spacetime supersymmetry.

entry.title: Two--poles R-matrices
entry.summary: We study integrable dynamical systems described by a Lax pair involving a spectral parameter. By solving the classical Yang-Baxter equation when the R-matrix has two poles we show that they can be interpreted as natural motions on a twisted loop algebra.

entry.title: Comment on Gauge-Independent Analysis of Chern-Simons Theory with Matter Coupling
entry.summary: It is shown that a recently proposed relativistic field theory of anyons is mathematically flawed and also does not satisfy reasonable criteria for such a theory.

entry.title: On the definition of Quantum Free Particle on Curved Manifolds
entry.summary: A selfconsistent definition of quantum free particle on a generic curved manifold emerges naturally by restricting the dynamics to submanifolds of co-dimension one. PACS 0365 0240

entry.title: Twisted Sector Yukawa Couplings for the $Z_3\times Z_3$ Orbifold
entry.summary: The moduli dependent Yukawa couplings between twisted sectors of the $Z_3\times Z_3$ orbifold are studied.

entry.title: Strings and QCD?
entry.summary: Is large-$N$ QCD equivalent to a string theory? Maybe, maybe not. I review various attempts to answer the question.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, LaTeX. Presented at the Symposium on Black Holes, Wormholes, Membranes, and Superstrings, H.A.R.C., Houston, January 1992

entry.title: The complete solution to the constant quantum Yang-Baxter equation in two dimensions
entry.summary: We describe how the complete solution to the two-dimensional constant quantum Yang-Baxter equation [J. Hietarinta, Phys. Lett. A165,245(1992)] was found. (Talk presented at the XIX International Colloquium on Group Theoretical Methods in Physics.)

entry.title: Exactly Solvable Potentials and Quantum Algebras
entry.summary: Self-similar potentials and corresponding symmetry algebras are briefly discussed. Talk presented at the XIXth ICGTMP, Salamanca, 29 June - 4July 1992.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. of XIX ICGTMP, Anales de Fisica, Monografias, CIEMAT/RSEF, Madrid (1993) Vol. I, pp. 198-201

entry.title: Quantum Group Symmetries in Conformal Field Theory
entry.summary: Quantum groups play the role of hidden symmetries of some two-dimensional field theories. We discuss how they appear in this role in the Wess-Zumino-Witten model of conformal field theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, Talk given at Oji Seminar on Quantum Analysis, Kyoto, June 25-29, 1992

entry.title: Anyons on a Torus
entry.summary: We prove the equivalence between anyon quantum mechanics on a torus and Chern-Simons gauge theory. It is also shown that the Hamiltonian and total momenta commute among themselves only in the physical Hilbert space.

entry.title: Harmonic potentials for symmetric quaternionic sigma-models
entry.summary: A reference has been corrected

entry.title: Jordanian Solutions of Simplex Equations
entry.summary: We construct for all $N$ a solution of the Frenkel--Moore $N$--simplex equation which generalizes the $R$--matrix for the Jordanian quantum group.

entry.title: 2D Supergravity and Integrable Systems
entry.summary: Integrable hierarchy based on the constrained Osp(2$\mid%2) connection is considered. The connection with 2D supergravity and some analogies with the W$_3^{(2)}$ case are given. It is shown that super Virasoro transformations are symmetries of tha hierarchy.

entry.title: BRST and Anti-BRST Quantization of Topological Yang-Mills Theory
entry.summary: Withdrawn.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages (Withdrawn: This paper turns out incomplete and even misleading. I must apologize to all of the recipients.)

entry.title: The Ashtekar Formalism and WKB Wave Functions of N=1,2 Supergravities
entry.summary: The N=1,2 supergravities with non-zero cosmological constants are investigated in the Ashtekar formalism. We solve the constraints of the N=1,2 supergravities semi-classically. The resulting WKB wave functions are expressed by exponentials of supersymmetric-extended SL(2,C) Chern-Simons functional.

entry.title: Dilogarithm identities and spectra in conformal field theory
entry.summary: We prove new identities between the values of Rogers dilogarithm function and describe a connection between these identities and spectra in conformal field theory.

entry.title: On Free Boson Representations of the Quantum Affine Algebra $U_q(\widehat{\sl}_2)$
entry.summary: A boson representation of the quantum affine algebra $U_q(\widehat{\sl}_2)$ is realized based on the Wakimoto construction. We discuss relations with the other boson representations.

entry.title: Particle Content in Topological Field Theories
entry.summary: By demanding that the path integral measure of topological field theories be metric independent, we can derive powerful constraints on the particle content of a topological field theory as well as on the dimensionality of space-time.

entry.title: A Continuum Approach to 2D-Quantum Gravity for C>1
entry.summary: A Lagrangian continuum model for a string theory with central charge $c>1$ is formulated by incorporating Weyl and diffeomorphism gauge fixing. In particular the tachyon scattering amplitudes are deduced generalizing the standard $c\le 1$ computation.

entry.title: Comment on "Attractive Forces between Electrons in 2 + 1 Dimensional QED"
entry.summary: It is shown that a model recently proposed for numerical calculations of bound states in QED$_3$ is in fact an improper truncation of the Aharonov-Bohm potential.

entry.title: Dilogarithm identities, q-difference equations and the Virasoro algebra
entry.summary: We give a new proof of the dilogarithm identities, associated to the (2,2n+1) minimal models of the Virasoro algebra.

entry.title: A Deformed Poincaré Algebra On A Cubic Lattice
entry.summary: Replacing the continuous space by a cubic lattice we find a deformation of the Poincar\'e algebra. A deformation of the relativistic mass operator is shown to be a Casimir of the algebra. The real structure is preserved.

entry.title: Dilogarithm identities, partitions and spectra in conformal field theory, I
entry.summary: We prove new identities betweenthe values of Rogers dilogarithm function and describe a connection between these identities and spectra in conformal field theory.

entry.title: Generating Vector Boson Masses
entry.summary: If the Higgs particle is never found, one will need an alternative theory for vector boson masses. I propose such a theory involving an antisymmetric tensor potential coupled to a gauge field.

entry.title: Categorical Physics
entry.summary: I propose a new mathematical form for the quantum theory of gravity coupled to matter. The motivation is from the connection between CSW TQFT and the Ashtekar variables. I also connect the algebraic structure of TQFT with some thoughts about the interpretation of quantum mechanics in a general relativistic setting.

entry.title: Twisted Sector Yukawa Couplings For The ${\bf Z}_M\times {\bf Z}_N$ Orbifolds
entry.summary: The moduli dependent Yukawa couplings between twisted sectors of ${\bf Z}_M\times {\bf Z}_N$ Coxeter orbifolds are studied.

entry.title: SU(2) and the Kauffman bracket
entry.summary: A direct relationship between the (non-quantum) group SU(2) and the Kauffman bracket in the framework of Chern-Simons theory is explicitly shown.

entry.title: Exact Duality Symmetries in CFT and String Theory
