entry.summary: There is substancial overlap with hepth-9211081. More results are presented for duality in the non-compact case. It is argued that duality persists as a symmetry also in that case.

entry.title: Constrained Dynamics of the Coupled Abelian Two-Form
entry.summary: I present the reduction of phase space of the theory of an antisymmetric tensor potential coupled to an abelian gauge field, using Dirac's procedure. Duality transformations on the reduced phase space are also discussed.

entry.title: Quantum Canonical Transformations: Physical Equivalence of Quantum Theories
entry.summary: Two quantum theories are physically equivalent if they are related, not by a unitary transformation, but by an isometric transformation. The conditions under which a quantum canonical transformation is an isometric transformation are given.

entry.title: On the Squeezed Vacuum States Corresponding to the General Two-Mode Bogolubov Transformation
entry.summary: In this paper the explicit form of the operator of transformation of the vacuum states for the general two-mode Bogolubov transformation is found

entry.title: Lectures on W-Gravity, W-Geometry and \W-Strings
entry.summary: Lectures given at the Trieste Summer School, 1992. These notes are an update of my review article "Classical and Quantum W-Gravity", preprint QMW-92-1, published in in "Strings and Symmetries 1991", with some extra material on W-geometry, W-symmetry in conformal field theory and W-strings.

entry.title: Division algebras, Galois fields, quadratic residues
entry.summary: Intended for mathematical physicists interested in applications of the division algebras to physics, this article highlights some of their more elegant properties with connections to the theories of Galois fields and quadratic residues.

entry.title: We Are Not Stuck With Gluing
entry.summary: We show that the construction of Ocneanu, which yields 1 for any 4D manifold, is not identical to our construction, which gives different numbers for different manifolds.

entry.title: The quantum bialgebra associated with the eight-vertex R-matrix
entry.summary: The quantum bialgebra related to the Baxter's eight-vertex R-matrix is found as a quantum deformation of the Lie algebra of sl(2)-valued automorphic functions on a complex torus.

entry.title: Exact solution of the deformed biquadratic spin 1 hamiltonian
entry.summary: Remarks about highest weight states of the underlying quantum group are corrected.

entry.title: Wave Functional of Quantum Black Holes in Two Dimensions
entry.summary: The wheeler-DeWitt method is applied to the quantization of the 1 + 1 dimensional dilaton gravity coupled with the conformal matter fields. Exact solutions to the WD equations are found, which are interpreted as right(left)-moving black holes.

entry.title: Super Black Holes
entry.summary: A quantum version of 2D super dilaton gravity containing a black hole is constructed for $N>8$. A previous disagreement as to whether this is possible or not is resolved.

entry.title: Correlation functions of quantum q-oscillators
entry.summary: Nonlinearity of electromagnetic field vibrations described by q-oscillators is shown to produce essential dependence of second correlation functions on intensity and deformation of Planck distribution. Experimental tests of such nonlinearity are suggested.

entry.title: Algebraic Aspects of Orbifold Models
entry.summary: : Algebraic properties of orbifold models on arbitrary Riemann surfaces are investigated. The action of mapping class group transformations and of standard geometric operations is given explicitly. An infinite dimensional extension of the quantum group is presented.

entry.title: SU(2)-Effective Action Wiht the Nonanalytic Term
entry.summary: The nonanalytic $g^3$-term is calculated for SU(2)-effective action at finite temperature and the status of a gauge fields condensation is briefly discussed.

entry.title: On the fundamental group of the space of harmonic $2$-spheres in the $n$-sphere
entry.summary: We compute the fundamental group of the "moduli space" of classical solutions of the two dimensional Euclidean $S^n$-model.

entry.title: Schwinger Effect in String Theory
entry.summary: I discuss the quantum instability of an electric field in a theory of open strings.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3p. LATEX , Talk at Rome Workshop on Quantum Gravity, String Theory and Grand Unification, Ecole Polytechnique preprint A232.0393 (Previous submission corrupted by mailer)

entry.title: Differential geometry of the space of orbits of a Coxeter group
entry.summary: Differential-geometric structures on the space of orbits of a finite Coxeter group, determined by Groth\'endieck residues, are calculated. This gives a construction of a 2D topological field theory for an arbitrary Coxeter group.

entry.title: Topology in Physics - A Perspective
entry.summary: This article, written in honor of Fritz Rohrlich, briefly surveys the role of topology in physics.

entry.title: Two-Dimensional QCD at Infinite N and Finite T
entry.summary: We analyze two-dimensional large $N_c$ QCD at finite temperature and show explicitly that the free energy has the correct $N_c$ dependence.

entry.title: String Tension in QED from Coulomb Gauge Correlators
entry.summary: We discuss the new Coulomb gauge method for testing confinement and measuring the string tension in the context of the Schwinger model and compact QED in 3 dimensions.

entry.title: Non-commutative quantum dynamics
entry.summary: We described a $q$-deformation of a quantum dynamics in one dimension. We prove that there exists only one essential deforamtion of quantum dynamics.

entry.title: Wess-Zumino-Witten model off criticality
entry.summary: We study the renormalization group flow properties of the Wess-Zumino-Witten model in the region of couplings between $g^2=0$ and $g^2=4\pi/k$, by evaluating the two-loop Zamolodchikov's $c$-function. We also discuss the region of negative couplings.

entry.title: Higher-Order Lagrangian Theories and Noetherian Symmetries
entry.summary: A geometric global formulation of the higher-order Lagrangian formalism for systems with finite number of degrees of freedom is provided. The formalism is applied to the study of systems with groups of Noetherian symmetries.

entry.title: The Free Field Representation of SU(3) Conformal Field Theory
entry.summary: (Revised LaTex version).The structure of free field representation and some correlation functions of the SU(3) CFT are considered.

entry.title: The Integrable Mapping as the Discrete Group of Inner Symmetry of Integrable Systems
entry.summary: It is shown that each integrable mapping is connected with a hierarchical completely integrable sytem of equations of evolution type which are invariant with respect to the transformation described by this mapping.

entry.title: A note on the four-dimensional Kirby calculus
entry.summary: An explicit derivation of the elements of the representation ring of SU(2) needed to implement the four-dimensional Kirby calculus is sketched.

entry.title: Some Comments on Lie-Poisson Structure of Conformal Non-Abelian Thirring Models
entry.summary: The interconnection between self-duality, conformal invariance and Lie-Poisson structure of the two dimensional non-abelian Thirring model is investigated in the framework of the hamiltonian method.

entry.title: A Comment on String Solitons
entry.summary: We derive an exact string-like soliton solution of D=10 heterotic string theory. The solution possesses $SU(2)\times SU(2)$ instanton structure in the eight-dimensional space transverse to the worldsheet of the soliton.

entry.title: A Study of Anyon Statistics by Breit Hamiltonian Formalism
entry.summary: We study the anyon statistics of a $2 + 1$ dimensional Maxwell-Chern-Simons (MCS) gauge theory by using a systemmetic metheod, the Breit Hamiltonian formalism.

entry.title: Transition Amplitude in 2+1 dimensional Chern-Simons Gravity on a Torus
entry.summary: The discussions on the modular invariance in section 5 are refined.

entry.title: Yang-Baxter equation, symmetric functions and Grothendieck polynomials
entry.summary: New development of the theory of Grothendieck polynomials, based on an exponential solution of the Yang-Baxter equation in the algebra of projectors are given.

entry.title: Combinatorial $B_n$-analogues of Schubert polynomials
entry.summary: Combinatorial $B_n$-analogues of Schubert polynomials and corresponding symmetric functions are constructed from an exponential solution of the $B_n$-Yang-Baxter equation that involves the nilCoxeter algebra of the hyperoctahedral group.

entry.title: Casimir operators of the exceptional group G2
entry.summary: We calculate the degree 2 and 6 Casimirs operators in explicit form, with the generators of G2 written in terms of the subalgebra A2

entry.title: Matrix Models and Integrable C<1 Open String Theories
entry.summary: No change at all but this time is possible to typset it!.

entry.title: Space-Time Transitions in String Theory
entry.summary: Simple mean field methods can be used to describe transitions between different space-time models in string theory. These include transitions between different Calabi-Yau manifolds, and more exotic things such as the Calabi-Yau/Landau-Ginzberg correspondence.

entry.title: Does noncommutative geometry predict nonlinear Higgs mechanism?
entry.summary: It is argued that the noncommutative geometry construction of the standard model predicts a nonlinear symmetry breaking mechanism rather than the orthodox Higgs mechanism. Such models have experimentally verifiable consequences.

entry.title: Super Triple Systems and Applications to Para-Statistics and Yand-Baxter Equation
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of ortho-symplectic super triple system, and apply it to find solutions of super Yang-Baxter equation. Also, the para-statistics are formulated as a Lie-super triple system.

entry.title: Euclidian 2D Gravity with Torsion
entry.summary: Closing a gap in the literature on the subject, the local solutions of 2D-gravity with torsion are given for Euclidian signature. For the topology of a cylinder the system is quantized.

entry.title: A new family of $SU(2)$ symmetric integrable sigma models
entry.summary: (Minor corrections and reference added)

entry.title: Dirac Monopoles and the Angular Momentum of the Electromagnetic Field
entry.summary: We present a possible solution for the long standing problem of the incompatibility of Dirac's charge quantization condition with integer values for the angular momentum of the electromagnetic field.

entry.title: Orthodox Gravity
entry.summary: A scalar field theory is investigated within the context of orthodox quantum gravity.

entry.title: The Wigner-Weyl formalism and the semi-classical relativistic approximation
entry.summary: The relativistic semi-classical approximation for a free massive particle is studied using the Wigner-Weyl formalism. A non-covariant Wigner function is proposed using the Newton-Wigner position operator. The perturbative solution for the time evolution is found. Causality is found to be perturbatively respected.

entry.title: Discrete Gauge Anomalies in String Theory
entry.summary: The original version of this paper contains an error; when this is corrected the basic conclusion changes. A revised manuscript will be submitted shortly.

entry.title: Multi--Soliton Solutions of Affine Toda Models
entry.summary: Hirota's method is used to construct multi--soliton and plane--wave solutions for affine Toda field theories with imaginary coupling.

entry.title: On the Chiral Fermions in the Twistor--Like Formulation of D=10 Heterotic String
entry.summary: An n=8 worldsheet superfield action is proposed for describing chiral fermions in the twistor-like formulation of an N=1, D=10 heterotic superstring.

entry.title: Symmetries and symmetry-breaking in string theory
entry.summary: This is a summary of a talk based on hep-th/9305139 and presented at the SUSY-93 International Workshop. We study infinite dimensional unbroken gauge symmetries which arise when time is toroidally compactified in string theory.

entry.title: BRST quantization of relativistic particles on inner product spaces
entry.summary: Recent results of BRST quantization on inner product spaces are reviewed. It is shown how relativistic particle models may be quantized with finite norms and that the relation between the operator method and the conventional path integral treatments is nontrivial.

entry.title: Star products and deformed oscillators
entry.summary: A star-product formalism describing deformations of the standard quantum mechanical harmonic oscillator is introduced. A number of existing generalized oscillators occur as particular choises of star-products between the elements of the ordinary oscillator algebra. Star dynamics and coherent states are introduced and studied.

entry.title: Background Fields in 2+1 Topological Gravity
entry.summary: The partition function of 2+1 Chern-Simons Witten topological gravity has an attractive interpretation in terms of the unbroken and broken phases of gravity. We make this physical interpretation manifest using the background field method.

entry.title: A Review of $W$ Strings
entry.summary: Recent progress on the physical states and scattering amplitudes of the $W_3$ string is reviewed with particular emphasis on the relation between this string theory and the Ising model.

entry.title: Interpolating gauge fixing for Chern-Simons theory
entry.summary: Chern-Simons theory is analyzed with a gauge-fixing which allows to discuss the Landau gauge and the light-cone gauge at the same time.

entry.title: W-Strings 93
entry.summary: We present a review of the status of $W$ string theories, their physical spectra, and their interactions. (Based on review talks given at the Trieste Spring Workshop, and the Strings 93 meeting at Berkeley, May 1993.)

entry.title: A note on Polyakov's nonlocal form of the effective action
entry.summary: A technical point regarding the invariance of Polyakov's nonlocal form of the effective action under uniform rescalings is briefly addressed.

entry.title: Black Holes and Cosmological Constant in Bosonic String Theory: Some Remarks
entry.summary: (some corrections in the semiclassical study and one reference added).

entry.title: Integrable Generalisations of the 2-dimensional Born Infeld Equation
entry.summary: The Born-Infeld equation in two dimensions is generalised to higher dimensions whilst retaining Lorentz Invariance and complete integrability. This generalisation retains homogeneity in second derivatives of the field.

entry.title: String Causality
entry.summary: Withdrawn due to error. See D. Lowe, L. Susskind and J. Uglum, hep-th/9402136, for correct treatment. Apologies to all recipients.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages (Withdrawn due to error. See D. Lowe, L. Susskind and J. Uglum, hep-th/9402136, for correct treatment.)

entry.title: Exact solution of the two-dimensional Dirac oscillator
entry.summary: In the present article we have found the complete energy spectrum and the corresponding eigenfunctions of the Dirac oscillator in two spatial dimensions. We show that the energy spectrum depends on the spin of the Dirac particle.

entry.title: The induced representayions of the $κ$-Poincare group. The massive case
entry.summary: The induced \6s of the $\kappa$-\1 for the massive case are described. It is shown that it extends many of the features of the classical case.

entry.title: The winding angle distribution for Brownian and SAW revisited
entry.summary: We study some generic aspects of the winding angle distribution around a point in two dimensions for Brownian and self avoiding walks (SAW) using corner transfer matrix and conformal field theory.

entry.title: Strings and Singularities
entry.summary: We review aspects of spacetime singularities from the view point of string theory. Examples considered include cosmological, cosmic string and black-hole singularities. We also discuss the consistency of viewing black-holes as excited states of fundamental strings (based on talk presented at Salamfest, March 1993, Trieste).

entry.title: The Higgs model for anyons and Liouville action
entry.summary: We connect Liouville theory, anyons and Higgs model in a purely geometrical way.

entry.title: Bound State Boundary S-matrix of the sine-Gordon Model
entry.summary: We study the boundary S-matrix for the reflection of bound states of the two-dimensional sine-Gordon integrable field theory in the presence of a boundary.

entry.title: Anyons as quon particles
entry.summary: The momentum operator representation of nonrelativistic anyons is developed in the Chern - Simons formulation of fractional statistics. The connection between anyons and the q-deformed bosonic algebra is established.

entry.title: Theory of Superselection Sectors for Generalized Ising models
entry.summary: We apply the theory of superselection sectors in the same way as done by G.Mack and V.Schomerus for the Ising model to generalizations of this model described by J.Fr\"{o}hlich and T.Kerler.

entry.title: Hot QCD
entry.summary: I discuss a comprehensive approach to the spacelike physics in high temperature QCD in three dimensions. The approach makes use of dimensional reduction. I suggest that this approach is useful for high temperature QCD in four dimensions.

entry.title: Global counterpart of $k$-Poincare algebra and covariant wave functions
entry.summary: The global counterpart of $k$-Poincare algebra is considered. The induced representations of this group are described. The explicit form of the covariant wave functions in the `minimal' (in Weinberg's sense) case is given.

entry.title: Charge sum rules in N=2 theories
entry.summary: Some errors in section 4 are corrected. No change in the results.

entry.title: Generalized quantization scheme for central extensions of Lie algebras
entry.summary: We present the method for finding of the nonlinear Poisson-Lie groups structures on the vector spaces and for their quantization. For arbitrary central extension of Lie algebra explicit formulas of quantization are proposed.

entry.title: A Class of FRT Quantum Groups and Fun$_q$(G$_2$) as a Special Case
entry.summary: Citations are updated; referred papers are increased. An error right after the eq.~(27) is corrected, and several chages (not serious) are made.

entry.title: Correlators of the Jost functions in the Sine-Gordon model
entry.summary: In this paper the quantum direct scattering problem is solved for the Sine-Gordon model. Correlators of the Jost functions are derived by the angular quantization method.

entry.title: Classical Field Theory and Analogy Between Newton's and Maxwell's Equations
entry.summary: A bivertical classical field theory include the Newtonian mechanics and Maxwell's electromagnetic field theory as the special cases. This unification allows to recognize the formal analogies among the notions of Newtonian mechanics and Maxwell's electrodynamics.

entry.title: On Pentagon And Tetrahedron Equations
entry.summary: We show that solutions of Pentagon equations lead to solutions of the Tetrahedron equation. The result is obtained in the spectral parameter dependent case.

author.name: J. M. Maillet
author.arxiv:affiliation: Laboratoire de Physique Theorique, ENS Lyon, France

entry.title: Deformation Quantization of the Isotropic Rotator
entry.summary: We perform a deformation quantization of the classical isotropic rigid rotator. The resulting quantum system is not invariant under the usual $SU(2)\times SU(2)$ chiral symmetry, but instead $SU_{q^{-1}}(2) \times SU_q(2)$.

entry.title: Structure of Multi-Anyon Wavefunctions
entry.summary: Symmetries of multi-anyon wavefunctions are analysed with the help of a second quantized formulation. Analogues of Slater determinants are constructed. It is shown that the Pauli principle is not enforced.

entry.title: Open Spin Chains and Quadratic Algebras
entry.summary: Algebraic framework for construction of a commuting set of operators that can be interpreted as integrals of motion of the open spin chain with boundary conditions and nearest neighbour interaction is investigated.

entry.title: Handle Operators in R.C.F.T
entry.summary: For the series associated to a group or coset R.C.F.T. there is a simple universal form for the inverse of the handle operator in the ring of fusions. These formulae may be easily understood from the quantization of the associated Chern-Simons theory. (Transcript of talk given at STRINGS '93 (Berkeley) Conference)

entry.title: Geometric Quantization of Topological Gauge Theories
entry.summary: We study the symplectic quantization of Abelian gauge theories in $2+1$ space-time dimensions with the introduction of a topological Chern-Simons term.

entry.title: Jordan Triple Systems and Yang-Baxter Equation
entry.summary: Jordan as well as related triple systems have been used to find several solutions of the Yang-Baxter equation, which are of rational as well as trigonometric type.

entry.title: Connes' Model Building Kit
entry.summary: Alain Connes' applications of non-commutative geometry to interaction physics are described for the purpose of model building.

entry.title: Vertex Operators are Not Closeable
entry.summary: We prove the uncloseability of the free vertex operators used in conformal field theory for the BRST--construction of primary fields. Our proof includes minimal models as well as WZNW--models.

entry.title: Quantum Spaces: Notes and Comments on a Lecture by S. L. Woronowicz
entry.summary: These notes are based on a lecture given by S. L. Woronowicz at the Institute of Mathematics, Polish Academy of Sciences.

entry.title: Strings and Two-dimensional QCD for Finite N
entry.summary: Minor corrections made and several references changed.

entry.title: On quasitriangular Hopf algebras related to the Borel subalgebra of sl(2)
entry.summary: Explicit isomorphism is established between quasitriangular Hopf algebras studied recently by O.Ogievetsky and by the present author.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, in: Proceedings of the Smorodinsky Memorial Conference 'Symmetry methods in physics' (Dubna, July 1993)

entry.title: Exact Yangian Symmetry in the Classical Euler-Calogero-Moser Model
entry.summary: We compute the $r$-matrix for the elliptic Euler-Calogero-Moser model. In the trigonometric limit we show that the model possesses an exact Yangian symmetry.

entry.title: A New Class of Supersymmetric Theories
entry.summary: We construct a class of quantum mechanical theories which are invariant under fermionic transformations similar to supersymmetry transformations. The generators of the transformations in this case, however, satisfy a BRST-like algebra.

entry.title: Target Space Duality in String Theory
entry.summary: A review article submitted to Physics Report: Target space duality and discrete symmetries in string theory are reviewed in different settings.

entry.title: A general transformation formula for conformal fields
entry.summary: An explicit transformation formula for chiral conformal fields under arbitrary holomorphic coordinate transformations is established. As an application I calculate the transformation law of the general quasiprimary field at level 4.

entry.title: Mappings of Multimode Bose Algebra Preserving Number Operators
entry.summary: We define a class of deformed multimode oscillator algebras which possess number operators and can be mapped to multimode Bose algebra.We construct and discuss the states in the Fock space and the corresponding number operators.

entry.title: Z(N) Bubbles and their Descendants in Hot QCD: Alive and Bubbling
entry.summary: The spontaneous breaking of Z(N) symmetry in hot QCD and the appearance of domain walls is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages plain TeX+5 PostScript figures in a uuencoded, compressed, tar file, included at the end of the text, CPT-94/P.3006

entry.title: Canonical Commutation Relations in The Schwinger Model
entry.summary: We give the first operator solution of the Schwinger model that obeys the canonical commutation relations in a covariant guage.

entry.title: Topological Inflation
entry.summary: Inflation can occur in the cores of topological defects, where the scalar field is forced to stay near the maximum of its potential. This topological inflation does not require fine-tuning of the initial conditions.

entry.title: Setting Hidden Symmetries Free by the Noncommutative Veronese Mapping
entry.summary: The short note is devoted to the setting free of hidden symmetries in Verma modules over sl(2,C) by the noncommutative Veronese mappings.

entry.title: Deformation analysis of matrix models
entry.summary: The Tracy-Widom equations associated with level spacing distributions are realized as a special case of monodromy preserving deformations.

entry.title: $S^7$ Current Algebras
entry.summary: We present $S^7$-algebras as generalized Kac-Moody algebras. A number of free-field representations is found. We construct the octonionic projective spaces ${\O}P^N$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, phyzzx and epsf, HUB-IEP-94/1, G\"oteborg-ITP-94-7

entry.title: q-oscillators, (non-)Kaehler manifolds and constrained dynamics
entry.summary: It is shown that q-deformed quantum mechanics (q-deformed Heisenberg algebra) can be interpreted as quantum mechanics on Kaehler manifolds, or as a quantum theory with second (or first-) class constraints. (Saclay, T93/027).

entry.title: N=2 Supersymmetry in Exterior Form
entry.summary: An $N=2$ supersymmetric model using K\"{a}hler fields is proposed. It is a modified version of two-dimensional Benn-Tucker model. It indicates a geometrical origin of $N=2$ supersymmetry.

entry.title: Diffeomorphisms of Curved Manifolds
entry.summary: We obtain an expression for the curvature of the Lie group SDiff$\cal M$ and use it to derive Lukatskii's formula for the case where $\cal M$ is locally Euclidean. We discuss qualitatively some previous findings for SDiff$S^{2}$ in conjunction with our result.

entry.title: Recoil Correction in the Dirac-Coulomb Problem
entry.summary: The expression for the first recoil correction to the Dirac-Coulomb spectrum is obtained employing the gauge invariance.

entry.title: Mirror Transform and String Theory
entry.summary: Some aspects of Mirror symmetry are reviewed, with an emphasis on more recent results extending mirror transform to higher genus Riemann surfaces and its relation to the Kodaira-Spencer theory of gravity (talk given in the Geometry and Topology Conference, April 93, Harvard, in honor of Raoul Bott)

entry.title: Negative Flows of the KP-Hierarchy
entry.summary: We construct a Grassmannian-like formulation for the potential KP-hierarchy including additional ``negative'' flows. Our approach will generalize the notion of a tau-function to include negative flows. We compare the resulting hierarchy with results by Hirota, Satsuma and Bogoyavlenskii.

entry.title: Explicit thermostatics of certain classical one-dimensional lattice models by harmonic analysis
entry.summary: A certain class of one-dimensional classical lattice models is considered. Using the method of abstract harmonic analysis explicit thermostatic properties of such models are derived. In particular, we discuss the low-temperature behavior of some of these models.

entry.title: Classical Electrodynamics with Dual Potentials
entry.summary: We present Dirac's method for using dual potentials to solve classical electrodynamics for an oppositely charged pair of particles, with a view to extending these techniques to non-Abelian gauge theories.

entry.title: Coulomb Gas Representation of the SU(2) WZW Correlators at Higher Genera
entry.summary: We express the correlation functions of the SU(2) WZW conformal field theory on Riemann surfaces of genus >1 by finite dimensional integrals.

entry.title: The Nappi-Witten example and gravitational waves
entry.summary: The vanishing of the anomaly in the recent example of Nappi and Witten, constructed from the Wess-Zumino-Witten model based on a certain non-semisimple group, follows from a more general result valid for gravitational waves. The construction of the metric is explained.}

entry.title: On Exact Integrability of 2D Poincare Gravity
entry.summary: We consider the 2D Poincar\'e gravity and show its exact integrability. The choice of the gauge is discussed. The Euclidean solutions on compact closed differential manifolds are studied.

entry.title: Tetramodules over the Hopf algebra of regular functions on a torus
entry.summary: Tetramodule is a vector space supplied with the bimodule and bicomodule structures over a Hopf algebra. The exact definition is given. Some properties and applications to quantum groups are discussed.

entry.title: On $δ$ perturbative interactions in the Aharonov-Bohm and Anyon Models
entry.summary: One discusses the validity and equivalence of various perturbative approaches for the Aharonov -Bohm and Anyon models.

author.name: Stéphane OUVRY
author.arxiv:affiliation: Division de Physique Théorique, IPN, Orsay Fr-91406

entry.title: Traversable Wormholes and Black Hole Complementarity
entry.summary: Black hole complementarity is incompatible with the existence of traversable wormholes. In fact, traversable wormholes cause problems for any theory where information comes out in the Hawking radiation.

entry.title: A trial to find an elliptic quantum algebra for $sl_2$ using the Heisenberg and Clifford algebra
entry.summary: A Heisenberg-Clifford realization of a deformed $U(sl_{2})$ by two parameters $p$ and $q$ is discussed. The commutation relations for this deformed algebra have interesting connection with the theta functions.

entry.title: Comment on ``the Klein-Gordon Oscillator''
entry.summary: The different ways of description of the $S=0$ particle with oscillator-like interaction are considered. The results are in conformity with the previous paper of S. Bruce and P. Minning.

entry.title: The Dirac-Dowker Oscillator
entry.summary: The oscillator-like interaction is introduced in the equation for the particle of arbitrary spin, given by Dirac and re-written to a matrix form by Dowker.

entry.title: 3nj-symbols and D-dimensional quantum gravity
entry.summary: The model which generalizes Ponzano and Regge $3D$ and Carfora-Martellini-Marzuoli $4D$ euclidean quantum gravity is considered. The euclidean Einstein-Regge action for a $D$-simplex is given in the semiclassical limit by a gaussian integral of a suitable $3nj$-symbol.

entry.title: Weinstein -- Xu invariants and link group representations
entry.summary: Topological interpretation of the link invariants associated with the Weinstein--Xu classical solutions of the quantum Yang-Baxter equation are provided.

entry.title: The Scattering of Strings in a Black-Hole Background
entry.summary: In this paper, correlation functions of tachyons in the two-dimensional black-hole are studied. The results are shown to be consistent with the prediction of the deformed matrix model.

entry.title: Quantum Optimal Control Theory
entry.summary: The possibility of control of phenomena at microscopic level compatible with quantum mechanics and quantum field theory is outlined. The theory could be used in nanotechnology.

entry.title: The Geometry of Electric Charge: The Charge Characteristic Class
entry.summary: It is well known that magnetic monopoles are related to the first Chern class. In this note electric charge is used to construct an analogous characteristic class: the charge class.

entry.title: Supergravity and the quest for a unified theory
entry.summary: A recollection of some theoretical developments that preceded and followed the first formulation of supergravity theory is presented. Special emphasis is placed on the impact of supergravity on the search for a unified theory of fundamental interactions.

entry.title: The role of the superstring dilaton in cosmology and particle physics
entry.summary: Superstring theory predicts the existence of a scalar field, the dilaton. I review some basic features of the dilaton interactions and explain their possible consequences in cosmology and particle physics.

entry.title: Event Symmetric Open String Field Theory
entry.summary: Field Theory on Event Symmetric space-time is constructed using the gauge group of discrete open strings. Models with invariant actions can be viewed as natural extensions of Matrix Models. The objective is to find a fundamental non-perturbative pre-theory for superstrings.

entry.title: Infrared Behaviour, sources and the Schwinger action principle
entry.summary: The paper describes a dynamical analogy for the renormalization group which leads to insights into its structure.
entry.arxiv:comment: Revised version inluding cosmetic changes and some recent references

entry.title: $N=1$, 2D-Induced Polyakov Supergravity on a Super Riemann Surface
entry.summary: An effective action for $N=1$, 2d-induced supergravity in the chiral gauge is obtained on a compact super Riemann surface without boundary and of arbitrary genus.

entry.title: Chiral fermion action with (8,0) worldsheet supersymmetry
entry.summary: We propose an action describing chiral fermions with an arbitrary gauge group and with manifest $(8,0)$ worldsheet supersymmetry. The form of the action is inspired by and adapted for completing the twistor-like formulation of the $D=10$ heterotic superstring.

entry.title: Wave Functionals, Hamiltonians and Renormalization Group
entry.summary: We analyze the renormalization of wave functionals and energy eigenvalues in field theory. A discussion of the structure of the renormalization group equation for a general Hamiltonian system is also given.

entry.title: Some New Solutions of Yang-Baxter Equation
entry.summary: We have found some new solutions of both rational and trigonometric types by rewriting Yang-Baxter equation as a triple product equation in a vector space of matrices.

entry.title: Quantum groups and Jordan structures
entry.summary: This paper is meant to be an informal introduction to Quantum Groups, starting from its origins and motivations until the recent developments. We call in particular the attention on the newly descovered relationship among quantum groups, integrable models and Jordan structures.

entry.title: Derivations and noncommutative differential calculus II
entry.summary: We characterize the derivation $d:A\to \Omega^1_{\der}(A)$ by a universal property introducing a new class of bimodules.

entry.title: Quantum determinants
entry.summary: We show how to construct central and grouplike quantum determinants for FRT algebras A(R). As an application of the general construction we give a quantum determinant for the q-Lorentz group.

entry.title: Elements of nonlinear quantum mechanics (Part II): Triple bracket generalization of quantum mechanics
entry.summary: A new version of NLQM is formulated in terms of the generalized Nambu dynamics. The generalization is free from the difficulties of earlier approaches. The paper is a second part of "Elements of NLQM (I): NL Schrodinger equation and two-level atoms".

entry.title: Introduction to Duality
entry.summary: We describe the duality between different geometries which arises by considering the classical and quantum harmonic map problem. To appear in ``Essays on Mirror Manifolds II''.

entry.title: Environmentally Friendly Renormalization in Finite-Temperature Field Theory
entry.summary: Contribution to the proceedings of the NATO workshop on the Electroweak Phase Transition and the Early Universe, Sintra, March 1994. To be published by Plenum Press.

entry.title: Some remarks on the Gauss decomposition for quantum group GL_q(n)
entry.summary: In this letter some properties of the Gauss decomposition of quantum group $GL_q(n)$ with application to q-bosonization are considered.

entry.title: ``Integrating in'' and exact superpotentials in 4d
entry.summary: We discuss integrating out matter fields and integrating in matter fields in four dimensional supersymmetric gauge theories. Highly nontrivial exact superpotentials can be easily obtained by starting from a known theory and integrating in matter.

entry.title: Residues in Non-Abelian Localization
entry.summary: In this paper we obtain an expression for the residue as it occurs in the non-Abelian localization formula due to Jeffrey and Kirwan. This expression can be used in cohomology computations for symplectic quotients.
